Award.AwardTitle: MRI: Acquisition of a Testbed of Connected Autonomous MicroTransit Vehicles

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration: This Major Research Instrumentation (MRI) award supports the acquisition of three connected autonomous microtransit vehicles (CAV) to conduct interdisciplinary research leading to the development, implementation, and validation of advanced transportation solutions. Microtransit vehicles can play a key role in meeting the transportation needs in population-dense areas such as downtowns or campus settings and in mobility-disadvantaged areas. The testbed will be featured in a new course and will enhance CAV-related undergraduate and graduate education. It will also be used to enhance the efforts of the Inclusive Engineering Consortium, K-12 activities for underrepresented groups, and outreach to the broader Greensboro community.<br/><br/><br/>The testbed provides a multi-user configurable research platform that leverages autonomy and transportation research capabilities at NC A&T State University. The instrumentation enables fundamental research on transportation, communications, networks, and real-time systems. The research projects will enable advances in cooperative control of autonomous vehicles, on-demand mobility services to meet distributed demands, validation and autonomy-enabled algorithms for CAVs, testing and fault diagnosis of networked AVs and resilient Vehicle-to-infrastructure and vehicle to vehicle communication. The CAV testbed provides a catalyst for new regional and national research partnerships with academia, industry, and the national labs to advance research on networks of autonomous vehicles as an important component of public transportation systems.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Autonomous microtransit vehicles can provide on-demand and flexible routing and scheduling in the form of shared transit services, improving the efficiency, flexibility, and affordability of transportation systems. As a relatively low-cost transportation option, microtransit vehicles can connect disconnected communities, expand the service range of existing transportation systems, and fill transportation gaps in areas where traditional mass transportation solutions do not work.

Through this project, a testbed of autonomous microtransit vehicles was acquired and operationalized to form a state-of-the-art experimental setup for validating advanced transportation technologies and networked vehicles, including:

  1. Developing and implementing cooperative and fault-tolerant control of autonomous vehicles.

  2. Providing on-demand mobility services to meet spatiotemporally distributed demands.

  3. Validating autonomy-enabled algorithms for Connected and Autonomous Vehicles (CAVs).

  4. Testing real-time fault diagnosis of a network of autonomous vehicles.

  5. Developing an Internet of Things (IoT)-based approach for resilient communication and networking of Vehicles to Infrastructure (V2I) and Vehicles to Vehicle (V2V) communication via cloud-based and 5G communication structures.

The testbed engaged students and faculty at NCA&T University and transportation professionals in the local and regional communities. The testbed was also used for several demonstrations, public deployments, and technology transfer programs to assess and enhance public perception and awareness about CAVs and their impacts.

Additionally, the testbed was used to create a one-of-a-kind test facility and infrastructure for deploying autonomous vehicles in rural and underserved communities.

Related articles and videos:

• Public release about the testbed, its impact, and community engagement: https://www.ncat.edu/news/2020/09/nsf-award-network-self-driving-shuttles.php

• Public release about unveiling the AV rural test facility at NCA&T: https://www.ncat.edu/news/2022/11/ncat-unveils-aggie-autonomous-shuttles.php

• Video demonstration of the operationalized CAV testbed and engagement of students and researchers at NCA&T: https://youtu.be/rrYHvziGW2A?si=X3T6PbuC3JdmSCwB

• A documentary about the operation of the operationalized testbed of autonomous vehicles: https://www.pbs.org/video/what-its-like-to-test-drive-a-self-driving-car-kztsv9/
